00072 #ifndef SHA1_H
00073 #define SHA1_H
00074 
00075 //---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
00076 //hl includes
00077 #include "hl_types.h"
00078 
00079 //---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
00080 //enums
00081 
00082 #ifndef _SHA_enum_
00083 #define _SHA_enum_
00084 enum
00085 {
00086     shaSuccess = 0,
00087     shaNull,            /* Null pointer parameter */
00088     shaInputTooLong,    /* input data too long */
00089     shaStateError       /* called Input after Result */
00090 };
00091 #endif
00092 
00093 //---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
00094 //defines
00095 #define SHA1HashSize 20
00096 
00097 //---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
00098 //structs
00099 
00103 typedef struct SHA1_CTX
00104 {
00106         hl_uint32 Intermediate_Hash[SHA1HashSize/4];
00107 
00109         hl_uint32 Length_Low;            
00110 
00112         hl_uint32 Length_High;
00113 
00115         hl_uint16 Message_Block_Index;
00116 
00118         hl_uint8 Message_Block[64];      
00119 
00121         int Computed;
00122 
00124         int Corrupted;
00125 
00126 } SHA1_CTX;
00127

00129 //class definition
00130 
00140 class SHA1
00141 {
00142         private:
00143 
00162                         void SHA1PadMessage(SHA1_CTX *context);
00163 
00174                         void SHA1ProcessMessageBlock(SHA1_CTX *context);
00175 
00176         public:
00177 
00184                 int SHA1Reset(  SHA1_CTX *context);
00185 
00196                 int SHA1Input(  SHA1_CTX   *context,
00197                                 const hl_uint8 *message_array,
00198                                 unsigned int  length);
00199 
00209                 int SHA1Result( SHA1_CTX *context,
00210                                 hl_uint8     Message_Digest[SHA1HashSize]);
00211 };
